SENT.plain: The aim of our study is to determine the serum visfatin levels of patients with Behcet's disease and to investigate the relationship between visfatin, an adipokine released from adipose tissue, levels and activity of Behcet's disease
Fifty-eight patients with Behcet's disease were enrolled to the study
Nineteen of the patients were inactive, and 39 of them were active
We enrolled 30 healthy subjects as being control group
Visfatin and tumor necrosis factor alpha (TNF-α) levels were measured with ELISA method
Visfatin levels were significantly lower in patients with Behcet's disease whose illnesses were active or inactive than the control group (p < 0.05)
There was no significant difference between the active patient and inactive patient group

The reason for the lower levels of serum visfatin in active and inactive patients' group could be due to pro-inflammatory cytokines such as TNF-α and IL-6 which suppress genetic expression of visfatin in patients with Behcet's disease, or else
